step.context: I=\int\sqrt{1-4x^2}\, dx\text{ resembles the following} \\ \text{standard integral.}
step.tex: I=\int\sqrt{1-4x^2}\, dx =2\int \sqrt{\left(\dfrac{1}{2}\right)^2-x^2}\, dx \\ \text{is of the form }M\int \sqrt{a^2-x^2}\, dx \\ \text{where $M=2$ and $a=\dfrac{1}{2}$}
I=\int\sqrt{1-4x^2}\, dx =\int \sqrt{1^2-(2x)^2}\, dx \\ \text{is of the form }M\int \sqrt{a^2-x^2}\, dx \\ \text{where $M=1$ and $a=1$}
step.reason: I=M\int \sqrt{a^2-x^2\, dx}\text{ form requires that the} \\ \textbf{coefficient of $x$ be 1.}
